alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Dawson; DeKalb; Forsyth; Gwinnett; Hall; Lumpkin; North Fulton; Pickens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 2:45AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Cherokee, northwestern DeKalb, Forsyth, southwestern Lumpkin, central Gwinnett, Dawson, southwestern Hall, northeastern Fulton and southern Pickens Counties through 315 AM EDT... At 245 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Talmadge to Birmingham to North Atlanta, and moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Atlanta, Lawrenceville, Canton, Decatur, Cumming, Jasper, Dawsonville, Peachtree Corners, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Johns Creek, Alpharetta, Dunwoody, Milton, Duluth, Sugar Hill, Snellville, Suwanee, Buford and Lilburn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Cherokee; Dawson; DeKalb; Forsyth; Gwinnett; Hall; Lumpkin; North Fulton; Pickens
